div.bibl: De Forenede Staters Danske Almanak, 1914. [THE DANISH YOUNG PEOPLE'S SOCIETY]

body.p: The aim of Dansk Ungdomsforening (Danish Young People's Society) is to gather Danish youth in a home for lectures, singing, discussions, and reading of Danish papers and books and to help in case of sickness and death. It was started June 2, 1889. The Society meets the second and fourth Wednesday of the month in the Dansk Ungdomshjen (The Danish Young People's Home) 1214 North Clarendon Avenue. On July 1, 1913 it had 127 members. The Society owns its own home, a three-story building built in 1892. The library of 557 volumes, consists mostly of modern Danish literature.
